p: Both monoterpenes displayed 13C-coupled satellites due to the presence of multiply 13C-labelled isotopologues. On the basis of the specific coupling constants and the detection of specific correlation patterns in INADEQUATE and 1,1-ADEQUATE experiments ( Figure 5, Figure 6 and Figure 7), it can be concluded that the isotopologue profiles of both compounds were highly specific. As shown in Table 2, Table 3 and Table 4 and Figure 5, Figure 6 and Figure 7, we assigned 10 and 7 13C 2-isotopologues in camphor and cineole, respectively. Moreover, the detection of long-range 13C-couplings lead to the assignment of 13C-isotopologues in camphor and cineole, as well ( Table 2, Table 3 and Table 4 and Figure 5, Figure 6 and Figure 7).
